metadata: (info { (description "Pulijudamu is a hunt game played in India. This game was mentioned in the Simhasana Dvatrimsika, and is still played in the area around Vijayanagara.") (rules "Triangle board, with a rectangle intersecting the triangle. A small triangle at each corner of the rectangle, with the apex at the corner of the rectangle. One player plays as four tigers, the other as sixteen goats.") (source "DLP evidence.") (id "1489") (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/hunt/reconstruction/pending") (credit "Eric Piette") (origin "This game was played in India, from around 1398 to 2003.") } ) (graphics { (show Edges Diagonal Hidden) }) (recon { (concept "NumStartComponents" 20) })
